name: Matilde Díaz
description: '''Aura Matilde Díaz Martínez''' (1924–2002), better known by her artist name '''Matilde Díaz''', was a Colombian performer of [[porro]]s and [[bolero]]s. She was the wife of [[Lucho Bermúdez]], who was also known for his porros and boleros. She claimed to be the first woman to be sing for a Colombian orchestra. Díaz died on 8 March 2002 from cancer in Bogota. She was posthumously inducted into the [[International Latin Music Hall of Fame]] on 10 April 2002, one month after her death.
